noun.description: A situation, typically one involving opposing parties, in which no progress can be made.
examples: an attempt to break the deadlock

noun.description: A type of lock requiring a key to open and close it, as distinct from a spring lock; a deadbolt.

verb.description: Cause (a situation or opposing parties) to come to a point where no progress can be made because of fundamental disagreement.
examples: the jurors were deadlocked on six charges
